Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Billy Yip, Chinese Herald Christian Crusade, 48 Allen Street, New York, NY 10002.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Billy Yip, Chinese Herald Christian Crusade, 48 Allen Street, New York, N.Y. 10002.

Council Member Chin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 3, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gentile.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gentile moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 3, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 533 Grand Street, Community Board 1, Application 20105403 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 533 Grand Street, Brooklyn (20105403TCK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 623 Grand Street, Community Board 1, Application 20105442 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 623 Grand Aven, Brooklyn (20105442TCK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sound reproduction devices on sight-seeing buses.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with a Message of Necessity
Items.MinutesNote: With Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sound reproduction devices on sight-seeing buses.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2008, Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2008, Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to reintroduce and pass legislation that would amend the Public Health Service Act with respect to facilitating the development of microbicides for preventing transmission of HIV and other diseases.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Ignizio and Oddo.

The following 2 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Halloran and Vallone, Jr.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Public Health Service Act with respect to facilitating the development of microbicides for preventing transmission of HIV and other diseases.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Food and Drug Administration to reverse their longstanding prohibition on homosexual men donating blood.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Ignizio..

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Halloran, Koo and Oddo.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: FDA to reverse their longstanding prohibition on homosexual men donating blood.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and President Obama to sign a just and humane comprehensive immigration reform bill in 2010.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


The following Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Halloran, Ignizio and Oddo.

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Vallone, Jr.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass and President Obama to sign a just and humane comprehensive immigration reform bill in 2010.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Juvenile Justice
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of juvenile justice to report on demographic data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the  department of juvenile justice to regularly report data concerning its use of physical restraint, mechanical restraint, and room confinement, injuries to children and allegations of child abuse and neglect.

Items.MatterName: Commissioner of the dept of juvenile justice to regularly report data concerning the dept’s use of physical restraint, mechanical restraint, and room confinement, injuries to children and allegations of child abuse and neglect.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Savino, S.6784, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9885, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to the training of fire officers in cities of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Training of fire officers in cities of one million or more (S.6784/A.9885).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Duane, S.4278, and Assembly Members Rosenthal and Kellner, A.6158-A, “AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and  the  administrative code  of  the city of New York, in relation to establishing a New York city animal  population  control  program  and  an  animal  population control fund; and to amend chapter 115 of the laws of 1894 relating to the better protection of lost and strayed animals and for securing the rights of owners thereof, in relation to licensing fees”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a NYC animal population control program and an animal population control fund. (S.4278/A.6158-A)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the arraignment process.

Items.MatterName: Arraignment process.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make automated external defibrillators available to primary, intermediate and high schools that do not already receive such devices under any other provision of law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make automated external defibrillators available to primary, intermediate and high schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to securing personal information privacy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Securing personal information privacy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sound reproduction devices on sight-seeing buses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Sound reproduction devices on sight-seeing buses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring grocery stores over 5,000 square feet to provide an electrical plug for delivery food trucks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring grocery stores over 5,000 square feet to provide an electrical plug for delivery food trucks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to street numbers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: In relation to street numbers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to accessible pedestrian signals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Accessible pedestrian signals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring trained  pedestrian safety managers at constructions sites on or near city sidewalks.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring trained  pedestrian safety managers at constructions sites on or near city sidewalks.

Items.Title: Proposed authorizing resolution submitted by the Mayor pursuant to Section 363 of the Charter for the granting of franchises for installation of telecommunications equipment and facilities on, over and under the inalienable property of the City in connection with the provision of mobile telecommunications services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Granting of franchises for installation of telecommunications equipment and facilities on, over and under the inalienable property of the City in connection with the provision of mobile telecommunications services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to illegal signs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Notices of violation issued by the department of buildings for illegal signs or billboards.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of naming a newly designated space at City College in honor of General Colin Powell as “The Colin L. Powell Hall.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Naming a newly designated space at City College in honor of General Colin Powell as “The Colin L. Powell Hall.”

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to conduct a feasibility study on the acquisition of former Catholic school buildings as sites to house special public education programs, charter schools and traditional public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to conduct a feasibility study on the acquisition of former Catholic school buildings as sites to house special public education programs, charter schools and traditional public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture for its efforts in preserving materials documenting the experiences of people of African descent throughout the world and urging the New York Public Library to maintain the Schomburg Center as one of the preeminent research libraries in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commending the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.1461, which would amend the public authorities law, in relation to establishing a no fare program for transportation on the New York City Transit Authority system, the Long Island Rail Road, and the Metro-North Commuter Railroad Company for senior citizens.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Establishing a no fare program for transportation on the NYCTA system, the Long Island Rail Road, and the Metro-North Commuter Railroad Company for senior citizens. (A.1461)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to professional certification by registered design professionals charged with a criminal offense.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Professional certification by registered design professionals charged with a criminal offense.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the dismissal of a notice of violation when access is denied to an owner to make repairs to or inspect a dwelling unit.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Dismissal of a notice of violation when access is denied to an owner to make repairs to or inspect a dwelling unit.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass the "Dignity For All Students Act" (A.03661-C/S.01987B), a bill that would establish policies and procedures to provide all students in public schools with an environment free of harassment and discrimination based on actual or perceived race, color, weight, national origin, ethnic group, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, or sex.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to pass the "Dignity For All Students Act" (A.03661-C/S.01987B)

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress to pass the Uniting American Families Act and to consider the elements of the Uniting American Families Act when preparing a comprehensive immigration reform bill.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Uniting American Families Act.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Replacement cycles for taxicabs and repealing paragraph 3 of subdivision b of section 19-535.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to notify schools of crimes against children within 1,000 feet of certain schools.

Items.MatterName: Public notice prior to the permanent removal of any emergency medical service station.

Items.MatterName: Comprehensive tracking of firefighting response times.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Sales of cooperative apartments.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to merging the department of juvenile justice and the administration for children’s services, and to repeal chapter 28 of such charter and subparagraph iii of paragraph 5 of subdivision a of section 12-307 of such code in relation thereto.

Items.MatterName: Merging the department of juvenile justice and the administration for children’s services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and Governor Paterson to develop a more equitable method of billing New York City for placement of its youth in state run facilities in order to allow the city to reinvest monies into alternative-to-placement programs.

Items.MatterName: Develop a more equitable method of billing New York City for placement of its youth in state run facilities in order to allow the city to reinvest monies into alternative-to-placement programs.

Items.MatterName: Notification when the NYC Dept of Education is considering the opening, closing and/or consolidation of a school. (A.01291)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to report on race and ethnicity, zip code of residence, precinct of arrest and charged offense of adolescents admitted to city jails.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the dept of correction to report on race and ethnicity, zip code of residence, precinct of arrest and charged offense of adolescents admitted to city jails.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of correction to develop a discharge plan for adolescents leaving city jails.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Senate Bill No. S. 4387A and Assembly Bill A. 5287, proposed legislation that would establish educational standards regarding the management of pain, and require all health care practitioners to complete course work or training regarding pain management.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establish educational standards regarding the management of pain. (S.4387A/ A.5287)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing a credit against the commercial rent or occupancy tax imposed by chapter 7 of title 11 of such code, to tenants who provide employer-provided child care.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Providing a credit against the commercial rent or occupancy tax imposed by chapter 7 of title 11 of such code, to tenants who provide employer-provided child care.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to divest its assets from financial institutions that evade New York State’s usury law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: NYC divest its assets from financial institutions that evade NYS’s usury law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the federal government to institute a national usury law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Federal Government to institute a national usury law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2008, Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2008, Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to rates for the towing of motor vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Rates for the towing of motor vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact H.R. 4224, the “Together We Care Act of 2009,” which would establish a pilot program to train public housing residents as home health care aides and in home-based health care services to enable residents to provide covered home-based health care services to residents of public housing and residents of federally-assisted rental housing, who are elderly or persons with a disability.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Congress to enact H.R. 4224, the “Together We Care Act of 2009."

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring the Fire Commissioner to send certain reports to the City Council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Fire Commissioner to send certain reports to the City Council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the submission of quarterly reports by the New York City Police Department detailing the number of summonses issued to trucks for traffic infractions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Submission of quarterly reports by the NYPD detailing the number of summonses issued to trucks for traffic infractions.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the State Legislature to ban the use of grille-guards/bull bars on the front of all motor vehicles that operate in the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to ban the use of grille-guards/bull bars on the front of all motor vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Census Bureau to extend its April 15, 2010 deadline for returning Census forms and to keep both its Question Assistance Centers and Be Counted Sites open for an additional 30 days.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Census Bureau to extend its April 15, 2010 deadline for returning Census forms and to keep both its Question Assistance Centers and Be Counted Sites open for an additional 30 days.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the DOE to donate school lunches that have not been consumed.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to donate school lunches that have not been consumed.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States government to make Haitian recipients of Temporary Protected Status eligible for federal public benefits.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: U.S. government to make Haitian recipients of Temporary Protected Status eligible for federal public benefits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and Governor Paterson to develop a more equitable method of billing New York City for placement of its youth in state run facilities in order to allow the city to reinvest monies into alternative-to-placement programs.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Develop a more equitable method of billing New York City for placement of its youth in state run facilities in order to allow the city to reinvest monies into alternative-to-placement programs.
